data.title: Fix for Issue #170 Asset loading under Linux
data.body: Changed the case on a number of files that are referenced in script.

data.title: Some assets do not load under Linux dedicated server
data.body: It appears that some assets are referred using an incorrect case.  This causes them to not load under Linux, which requires the correct case is used for a file.  For example, soldier_rigged.DAE is referred to as soldier_rigged.dae in art/datablocks/player.cs.

data.title: When FMOD is used on client, it is also required on dedicated server
data.body:
If FMOD support has been compiled into a client, then it must also be compiled into a dedicated server (such as under Linux).  T3D's FMOD code adds three additional Datablocks:
- SFXFMODEvent
- SFXFMODEventGroup
- SFXFMODProject

This expands the Datablock class table that is used by T3D's networking.  If the dedicated server is not compiled with FMOD support then these Datablocks will not be a part of the server's class table.  When the class table is out of sync between a client and server, bad things happen (usually the client will Assert in strange places or crash).

It would be great if a dedicated server can be compiled with FMOD stubs without needing the FMOD library to be in place to at least allow the class tables to be in sync.

data.title: Animation Threads/Blending Issues
data.body:
I found an interesting issue I think has to do with some sort of node limit or something odd. The odd part is it isn't that one animation doesn't play but only part of it (1 of 4 nodes) and none of the nodes in any of the animations are shared.

It is detailed more in this post: http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/132421

I know it's a long post, just wanted to be thorough.

data.title: Fix for Issue #166 for Client Not Loading
data.body:
The issue was with sending the ack mask to the client when the ack byte
count was 4.

data.title: Client does not completely load with a dedicated server
data.body:
When connecting with a dedicated server, a connecting client appears to finish loading all of its objects and then just sits there forever.

Tracing through the datablock and object loading process on the server, it appears that the mission is sent correctly but the message to inform the client to start phase 3 in GameConnection::onGhostAlwaysObjectsReceived() is never received by the client.

This bug may have to do with the Bitstream changes that were made for issue #111.

data.title: SimObject Crashing
data.body:
See the latter conversation here: http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/132437/1#comment-837289

Apparently there is an issue in the SimObject (and all of it's derived sub-objects) that leads to crashing. The reason for this is currently unknown, but this definitely needs to be looked in to.

data.title: Euler to Quaternion conversion is incorrect

milestone.description: This version will focus on processing two of the major outstanding pull requests, James Urquhart's [TorqueScript interpreter improvements](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/81) and Tim Condon's [GUI additions](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/545). Along with that we'll be bringing in lots of other TS-related enhancements, adding unit tests for TS to make sure we don't break your games, and processing even more of the outstanding issue list.

data.title: Material Editor Crash- Opening the material editor with a mesh selected doesn't open a custom material. (THREED-3195)
data.body:
If you change a meshes material to a custom one, exit the material editor, then select the object and open the material editor, the material opened is not the current material on the mesh.
Expected: The current material on the selected mesh is opened.
Steps to reproduce:
1. Add any mesh to a level.
2. Select the mesh and open the material editor.
3. Change the material to a custom material.
4. Exit the material editor.
5. Make sure the mesh is selected and open the material editor again.
6. Observe the custom material is not opened, instead a broken material is opened.
7. Select your custom material again.
8. Observe Error/Crash.

data.title: GuiWebCtrl  (Web UI Control)
data.body:
1. Web and Flash Embedded in 3D Games, based on WebKit
2. DDS Image Decoder in WebKit
3. Load HTML from local filesystem or pakaging filesystem
4. Javascript bindings for C/C++

Demo:
http://sourceforge.net/projects/wke/files/Torque3D-WebUI-Demo-v1.20.7z/download

Source Code:
http://svn.code.sourceforge.net/p/wke/code/trunk/demo/wkeTorque3D
or
https://github.com/BlzFans/wke/tree/master/demo/wkeTorque3D

Full Source Code:
https://github.com/BlzFans/Torque3D

data.title: [please remove] GeForce GTX 660 Ti not compatible
data.body:
T3D 1.2 keeps on crashing since my new NVIDIA's GeForce GTX 660 Ti. Often these crashes end up in complete system freezes (Windows 7, 64bit)
- I tried all the NVDIA drivers compatible with this card (incl BETA)
- Clean-installed drivers and using Guru3D's driversweep
- Turned everything off in T3D from AA to postFX etc...
- Turned everything off in NVDIA's program settings
- Updated DirectX 9c, 10 and 11 including June 2010 SDK
- Turned 3 different AV apps completely off
- Running as Admin, fullscreen or in window
- Made sure it's not the keyboard, mouse, gamecontroller etc.
- Made sure it's not any malware
- Happens in all T3D projects, including the FPS example etc.
- Nothing shows up in system stress tests (like Sandra);
  Power (600Watt), GPU voltage, GPU temp, RAM temp etc.

Console is showing the message "Device needs to be reset, waiting on device..." and screen turns to the background color. Quickly pressing CTRL-ALT-DEL sometimes helps to restore T3D but often the system completely freezes and only a cold reset is then an option.

Does anyone have the same card and running T3D 1.2 without these kinds of issues?

data.title: [Recast] Made PrimBuilder buffer resize itself
data.body:
By default, the PrimBuilder expects you to specify beforehand how many vertices you will be rendering. When using the PrimBuilder to implement an OpenGL-like interface (say, for Recast's debug drawing facilities), you don't always know beforehand how many vertices will be drawn.

Now, instead of fatally asserting when more vertices are added than were expected, the code simply resizes the buffer.

data.title: Animation Thread/Blending bug
data.body:
I am playing, pausing and then setting the position of animations on several different threads (0-3) and most of the time one of my 4 animations won't do anything.

I posted more detail about it on the forums: http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/132421

data.title: Partial revert of changes from Pull #125
data.body:
Pull Request #125 was to fix Issue #124.  However, as reported by a
user, this fix broke the water.  This is a partial reversion of those
changes to get the water working again.  The fix from Pull #125 will
need to be examined.

data.title: TSForestItemData only loading materials on client
data.body:
Issue #155 was a fix for creating billboards on a dedicated server.  This came about because TSForestItemData::_getShapeInstance() is creating a shape instance and always loading the materials.  While issue #155 is a good fix, it may be able to be better.

Normally when a shape instance is created the materials are only loaded on the client.  TSForestItemData::_getShapeInstance() goes against this and creates the materials regardless of being on the client or server.  It appears to do this so it can check if it needs to add the wind effect to the shape.

However, the wind effect should be a client side only effect and I don't believe it needs to be checked on the server.  This ticket exists to look into not checking the materials on the server side, and therefore passing in isClient() into the shape creation's loadMaterials flag.

data.title: Fix for Issue #155 for Billboard Creation
Billboard Creation on Dedicated Server
TypeValidator Memory Leak
data.body: As pointed out in this blog: http://www.garagegames.com/community/blogs/view/22008 the way ParticleData and ParticleEmitterData implement type validators is likely causing a memory leak.  The type validators being used created within initPersistFields() are not being cleaned up.

data.title: Fix for Issue #152 for Unmatch Bitstream
data.body: This corrects for changes made in Pull Request #112.

data.title: Unmatched Bitstream changes in Pull Request #112
data.body:
Pull Request #112 (for issue #111) appears to have unmatched Bitstream changes.  The `write*()` method changes to the following files didn't have corresponding `read*()` changes:
- Engine/source/T3D/gameBase/gameConnectionEvents.cpp
- Engine/source/sfx/sfxDescription.cpp

This may be the reason for the reported crash in [datablock loading issues](http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/132372)

data.title: New gitignore for Project Manager
C++ SimXMLDocument Bug
data.body: The SimXMLDocument does not make a call to the required onAdd() function in it's constructor when trying to use it's features in C++, versus in TS. Thus when you attempt to use it in C++ and neglect this call, you will get an access violation crash when attempting to use any of the SimXMLDocument functions.

data.title: Toolbox Crashes
data.body:
So, I just got done upgrading my entire code-base to the MIT version (oh dear god how long that took :|), but now I have a new problem. The Torque 3D Toolbox crashes when I select a different project in my list.

I thought it was a residual issue from the old version so I rebuild and regenerated all of my projects, but the crashing still continues.

Easy repeat steps to confirm, make two projects in the manager, and select them.

EDIT:
Same as #99 (https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/issues/99), you may close this if you want.

data.title: Prevented looking up incorrect object handles

milestone.description: This version will focus on processing two of the major outstanding pull requests, James Urquhart's [TorqueScript interpreter improvements](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/81) and Tim Condon's [GUI additions](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/545). Along with that we'll be bringing in lots of other TS-related enhancements, adding unit tests for TS to make sure we don't break your games, and processing even more of the outstanding issue list.

data.body:
Previously, `dAtoi` would be called on arbitrary strings, which resulted in weird things like `"7.2 3 4.529"` being cast to `7`. Now, `Sim::findObject` checks that object handles (strings starting with a digit) actually only contain digits and slashes.

Refer to [this thread](http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/132371) and [this one](http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/117065).

data.title: Asserts cause T3D to halt and stay in the process list until killed
data.body: Asserts cause T3D to halt and stay in the process list until killed.

data.title: Player strafing while crouching looks wrong
data.body: In a multiplayer game (may happen in single player too) when the soldier is crouching and strafes left or right, the animation does not look right.  It may be that the animation sequence is missing a defined ground frame, and also it may not be playing in the right direction.

data.title: Client player crouching is delayed on host
data.body:
When hosting a game with a client on a separate computer (I tested over the LAN) hold down the crouch key on the client.  It will take a very long time before the host will display the crouching.  Making the player jump while crouched appears to cause the crouch to come through.

Interestingly, when the host crouches it seems that the client sees it right away.  Also, while testing the client and host on the same computer I did not see any delay.

data.title: GroundCover fading when zoomed in
data.body: Extends the visible distance of GroundCover when the camera is zoomed in. See [this thread](http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/132299/2#comment_form) for details.

data.title: ClientMissionCleanup not found

milestone.description: This release is the first that the new Steering Committee will be responsible for. Our aims are to process as many existing outstanding issues/pull requests as possible and implement good practises for the future of the engine, such as automatic compile/unit testing of pull requests, as well as managing the different release files.

data.body:
From time to time you will encounter a "ClientMissionCleanup not found" error, I recently encountered it when adding a ParticleEmitter to the mission file.
That may be whats causing it, but it seems silly not being able to add ParticleEmitters to your mission.

Anyway the fix by Mary Westmacott seems to have helped alot of people and I think it should be added to the T3D MIT:
http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/18673/1#comment-560798

But it have to be added to when you create a new mission aswell to be really effective.

data.title: Work for Issue #141 for Remove Toolbox
data.body:
Removed the old Toolbox and the Qt libraries, as well as all of the
Templates' game binaries.
